title: No non-interactive CLI command to stop running sessions by ID
description:
## Summary
There is currently no non-interactive CLI command to stop/terminate running sessions by ID.

## Current CLI Surface (as of 2026-02-14)
- `adaf sessions` lists sessions and offers `logs` / `output` subcommands.
- `adaf attach` can connect to a running session.
- Stop is currently documented only as an interactive key path while attached:
  - `Ctrl+C` in attach UI stops and detaches.

Observed from help output:
- `adaf sessions --help`
- `adaf sessions output --help`
- `adaf sessions logs --help`
- `adaf attach --help`

## Problem
This creates an operational gap:
- Cannot stop a runaway/hung session from scripts or automation.
- Cannot stop by session ID without entering interactive attach.
- Harder to manage remote/headless environments where interactive attach is inconvenient.

## Expected Behavior
Provide explicit stop/terminate control from CLI, for example:
- `adaf sessions stop <session-id>`
- Optional batch forms: `--all`, `--agent <name>`, `--loop <name>`
- Optional safety controls: `--force`, confirmation prompts for multi-stop.

## Suggested Acceptance Criteria
- Stop command targets a running session by ID without interactive attach.
- Returns clear exit code and status text (stopped, already finished, not found, permission denied, etc.).
- Emits auditable event/log entry for stop requests.
- Works consistently for parent loop sessions and spawned sessions.

## Impact
- Improves operability and automation.
- Reduces need for manual attach-only intervention in production-style usage.
